metadata.title: CVE-2020-10737 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: A race condition was found in the mkhomedir tool shipped with the oddjobpackage in versions before 0.34.5 and 0.34.6 wherein, during the homecreation, mkhomedir copies the /etc/skel directory into the newly createdhome and changes its ownership to the home's user without properly checkingthe homedir path. This flaw allows an attacker to leverage this issue bycreating a symlink point to a target folder, which then has its ownershiptransferred to the new home directory's unprivileged user.

criterions.comment: oddjob: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
